meanings.definition: To use money, resources, or time carefully and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: I always try to economise by buying things on sale.
meanings.sent2: It is important to economise when planning a budget.
meanings.sent3: My mom taught me to economise by turning off lights when not in use.
meanings.sent4: She managed to economise her time so well that she finished all her tasks early.
meanings.sent5: The wise old man showed the young ones how to economise resources for the future.

meanings.definition: To avoid waste or unnecessary expenditure.
meanings.sent1: We should economise on paper to save trees.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to economise by cutting down on unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to economise on nuts by storing them in a secret place.
meanings.sent4: She tried to economise on water by taking shorter showers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged the students to economise on supplies to reduce waste.

meanings.definition: To reduce costs or save money.
meanings.sent1: The family had to economise on groceries to afford a vacation.
meanings.sent2: They decided to economise by carpooling to work.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to economise on props for his show.
meanings.sent4: She managed to economise enough to buy her dream car.
meanings.sent5: The community worked together to economise funds for a new playground.
